content.question:
The function N satisfies the logistic differential equation <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mfrac> <mrow> <mi>d</mi><mi>N</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi> </mrow> </mfrac> <mo>=</mo><mfrac> <mi>N</mi> <mrow> <mn>10</mn> </mrow> </mfrac> <mrow><mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mn>1</mn><mo>−</mo><mfrac> <mi>N</mi> <mrow> <mn>850</mn> </mrow> </mfrac> </mrow> <mo>)</mo></mrow> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4448@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, where N(0) = 105. Which of

the following statements is false?

choices.label: <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mfrac> <mrow> <mi>d</mi><mi>N</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi> </mrow> </mfrac> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3A00@</annotation> </semantics> </math> has a maximum value when N = 105

content.answer: <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mfrac> <mrow> <mi>d</mi><mi>N</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi> </mrow> </mfrac> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3A00@</annotation> </semantics> </math> has a maximum value when N = 105

topic.text: 7.9: (BC ONLY) Logistic Models with Differential Equations
